As the week went by, Brian's weight skyrocketed. His face now sported cheeks the size of baseballs that sagged and jiggled with every movement of his mouth along with six chins and a thick roll of neck fat. His chest supported a pair of massive jiggly moobs that bounced with each of his panting breathes. His arms had developed thick sagging sleeves and folds of fat that flapped every time he lifted them. His legs were now covered in rolls and folds that lead to a big pair of thunder thighs. His ass now completely destroyed the couch he loved so much, spreading over it as if it had never existed. Lastly, his belly now spread itself along the floor a good five feet, wobbling, jiggling, and gurgling as if it were alive.

111311222231.content:
Brian tried to turn his head to see who was coming in, but his own oversized doughball of a cheek was so fat, it blocked his head from turning all the way. He had to hoist up his big puffy paw and lazily swing it back- letting it hit the floor with the same cathartic fwumph that all his footsteps made these days. When he finally got a glimpse of who it was past the sweaty, greasy horizon of his body, a smug smirk lit up his face.

"Hi-hi there, Bri-bri!!!" Came the high pitched, enthusiastic, gay-lisp having voice of Jasper, who bent backwards a bit and gave a playful, silly wave to his remarkably obese cousin-turned-lover. Jasper had come by to visit after Brian started to gain, and as soon as he laid his eyes on all that blubber- he instantly fell in love, ditching any other boyfriends of his and begging Brian to let him move in and be his official boyfriend.

Brian didn't mind turning gay, not even for his own cousin. That stuff didn't matter so much to Brian right now. What did matter was that Jasper was an amazing feeder- Eager and willing to go on near constant supply runs to every fast food joint and convenience store in driving distance, gathering up as much cheap, calorie dense, nutritionally void junk food as his car could hold- literally filling up the entire trunk, back seats, and passenger seat with heaps and heaps of it, enough food to weigh the car down a little, making it literally drive slower when full.

And one such supply run was exactly what Jasper had gotten back from just now.

"Ohhhhhh la la! You're looking bigger than ever!" Jasper said in a singsong, lusty voice. Skipping over to Brian, ogling his enormous moobs, which rested comfortably on his big belly, sweat stains pooling out from underneath them, where his fat squished against itself.

"I am bigger than ever- UUURRRRP- actually." Brian boasted, Jasper inhaling deeply as he benched, trying to take in the pungent aroma of his lover. Brian lifted up a heavy, thick, sweaty arm topped off with a handpaw so fat it didn't look like its pudgy fingers would be able to push the buttons on a phone. Brian curled his arm inwards, as if he was flexing his muscle- when in reality a foot and a half thick bingo wing simply hung off his bicep, squishing up against the fat of a foot thick forearm. Still, as soon as he flexed, Jasper eagerly leapt forwards- lovingly embracing his big thick bicep of blubber, squishing up into it and getting a massive sweat stain all across the front of his pink tank top. Brian chuckled, grunting with effort as he lifted his arm above his head- allowing Jasper to get at his armpit. Which Jasper immediately jumped at, taking a long, deep, sniff of Brian's intoxicating musk.

"I just chehhhh-wheeeze..." Brian started to say, before trailing off- the effort of lifting his fatty arm up too much for the lazy mutt. He let it flop back down to his blubbery side- smooshing Jasper's entire head and shoulders up in the dark, wet, hot, stinky fold of his armpit. Brian didn't even try to lift it again, just letting Jasper struggle to pull out, his movement making Brian's flab jiggle gloriously. By the time Jasper did manage to yank himself out, his entire head was soaked in sweat- his hair was all matted, and he wore the biggest gleeful grin on his face- his eyes wide with ecstasy. "Oooohhhhhh Bribri that was amazing!!! You HAVE to let me do that in your buttcrack sometime!"

A smug smile formed on Brian's pudgy, panting face. "Well... do I have...some good news...for you!" Brian said, breathing increasingly heavily as his knees shook- Standing up was way too much of a workout for him. He gave up, kicking out his lazy legs and simply allowing himself to fall back, slamming his fat ass onto the ground with an impact that made the building's foundations rumble a bit.

His huge, sweaty feet kicked out in front of him- the pillowy appendages so plumped up with fat, that a single one of his three squishy plump toes was bigger than Jasper's entire footprint. Their stench may well have been the most potent out of his entire body odor, and they were constantly sweating bullets- drops of hot perspiration trickling down between his toes and over his tender soles, dripping to the floor every few seconds like a light rain. His feet sweat so heavily that when he waddled around, they left large pawprint shaped stains everywhere he went.

Jasper knew what to do- he quickly dashed over to the closet, grabbing a pair of large plastic gardening buckets, placing one underneath each of Brian's plush pungent paws, giving a loving lick along the sole of Brian's right foot when he was over there, earning himself a mawful of the warm, sickeningly saccharine liquid which gave off such a nauseating stench. He swallowed it- wincing a little bit involuntarily. He loved drinking the stuff- Brian's foot sweat was the best tasting sweat on the blobby dog's body- but man did it have a kick to it! Still, he always loved when both buckets would inevitably fill up to near overflowing, and he got to bring them both on the climb up Brian's squishy greasy gut to his face, and got to watch him greedily guzzle both of them down, one after the other.

"Golly- you're such a gorgeous hunk of man meat, Brian~" Jasper said lovingly.

"I know," Brian replied, before grinning. "Not just that- but I just checked the scale." Jasper perked up at the mention of that, anticipating what Brian'd say next. Brian laughed proudly, spreading his arms wide open, as if showing off his greasy, sweaty, slobby body. "I'm officially a ton of fun!" Jasper's eyes widened, and he leapt to his feet- feverishly jumping up and down in delight and squealing.

"Ohhh myyyy GOOOOOOSSSSSHH! YOU DID IT- YOU HIT THE BIG TWO-TRIPLE-OH!" Jasper squealed, embracing Brian's expansive gut, sinking into it several inches. He jumped up again, beginning to excitedly speed talk- "omigoshomigosh- we gotta celebrate! This is a milestone! I'm gonna feed you the biggest meal of your entire life- just you wait! I'm gonna fill you up so much so fast that you-" Jasper's excited ramblings were cut off by a loud, resoundingly forceful, simultaneous belch and fart from Brian- which lasted a solid three seconds- before he gave Jasper a seductive, sultry look.

"Oh, you'd better make it one hell of a celebration feast. But first..." Brian said, smirking, "You still have a whole car full of the unhealthiest food in the county out there..."

Jasper grinned, winking as he added "and it's just about time for your post-brunch snack!"

Brian licked his chops eagerly, lightly wiggling his pudgy little fingers and plump oversized toes in anticipation, before demanding,

"Start feeding~"

111312.content:
Brian Griffin proudly strolled into the Griffin household with a grin on his face. There was an unusually high air of smugness radiating off the white dog today, and it wasn't hard to see why.

"Hey!.. hey Stewie!" Brian eagerly chimed for attention from the annoyed kid sitting on the couch reading the newspaper, "Do ya.. can you see anything different about me?" Brian asked, making sure to puff out his chest and pose in a faux-relaxed manner that showed off his biceps.

For the past few weeks, ever since a girl Brian had been dating suggested he had "more cushin for the pushin" Brian had been in panic mode, instantly joining a gym and going into workout overdrive, not only losing his slight winter weight, but actually making himself more fit and trim than he had ever been before in his life, not that that was saying much. But along the way of his exercise craze, as Brian had progressively gotten fitter, it had the unfortunate side-effect of also making Brian act more and more confident and douchey. By now, even though Brian's muscle gains were honestly not that huge or well defined and his weight loss could only reasonably put him into the 'average' class at best, Brian had become insufferably smug.

"Hmmm, no." Stewie replied in his best uncaring and aloof voice, lying that he didn't notice Brian had beefed up just a little bit more since he last saw him, "What? Have you, uh, have you gotten a new hair do?" Brian just snorted in reply.

"You know Brian, it says here in this advice column that sometimes personality is more important than appearance in a relationship, having a sexy body doesn't mean jack if the guy or gal behind it only wants to stare at themselves in the mirror all day, isn't that interesting?"
"Hmph, and why are you telling me that?"
"Oh I just thought you might find it thought provoking, maybe a theme you could expand on in your novel, you know, that novel you were writing before you spent all your time at the gym?"
"Hey, I don't spend all my time at the gym, I go shopping at health food stores, and uh, go to the pool in the mornings, I... do lots of other things. Besides, my book isn't a fiction novel anymore, it's going to be a motivational biography on how I got buff and you can be too!"
Stweie had to suppress a scoff of laughter, "Well, that sounds looooovely, a real page turner. "

Brian was about to retort, but was stopped when Peter burst in to the room with an urgent announcement. "Guys, you'll never believe what happened! Me and Joe were trying to put on a benefit concert for children without menopause insurance when during my big Miley Cyrus impersonation routine Quagmire got hit by a wrecking ball! He's dead!"

"Oh, that's a... disappointment, really, a shame." Brian replied, tail wagging.

"Anyway Brian, before it's too late I'm going to take his body all over the world and finally fulfil Quagmire's bucket list, it'll be great! This will take a couple of years, but I've got my plane ticket and leaving in half an hour. I'll phone Lois to tell her when I'm at Niger. Heh, Niger." And with that he was off.

"Huh..." Both Brian and Stewie said in unison.

"Whatever, I'm going to, uh... not stare at myself in the mirror now." Brian replied, happier than ever. Stewie watched out of the corner of his eye as Brian walked out the room with cocky swagger, he was ashamed to admit the sway of his butt was mesmerizing. He spent a few seconds thinking about what it must feel like to squeeze before he realized what he was doing and recoiled in disgust, "Gah, something must be done about that damn dog, he's acting like a self-satisfied jock... If I could just doing something about that damn attractive body of his... he'd be back to being his regular self-satisfied pseudo intellectual self in no time... Wait, I got it!" A wicked smile crossed Stewie's face as he concocted his plan.

1113122.content:
"Oh Brian!~" Stewie called out melodically down the hall, "I've got something heavy for you to lift"

Brian, who had been preoccupied with admiring his reflection, smirked to himself, both for how good he looked as he flexed and also at Stewie needing his help after he rubbished his exercise routine earlier. "Coming" he yelled back.

Stewie thought about making a dirty joke, but decided against it as he had to make sure everything worked exactly right. He placed the fake multiverse gun and lego block on the floor precisely where his complex math dictated it should go. "There, that should do it." he said to himself

"Do what?" Brian asked
"Wha? Oh nothing. Say Brian, you're a hulking young stud" Steiw greatly exaggerated, "be a good boy and help me move that large box of retro fashion magazines to the top shelf please?"
"fashion magazines?"
"Don't judge me, I just like the pretty dresses." Stewie said as he readied the real multiverse controller behind his back.

Brian picked up the box, it wasn't actually very heavy, but it was sure large, blocking his eyesight. "Now uh, you said you want it on the shelf? I don't know it it'll fit..."
"Oh I'm sure it will just give it a go, now just take a few steps to your left...."
"Ouch!" Brian yelped, as his foot trod on the lego. Brian dropped the box, smashing it down on the fake multiverse gun. "Jeeze Stewie, you really ought to clean your damn room once in a while!" the dog yelled hopping around, just before Stewie pressed a button on the real multiverse gun.

"Oh nooo" Stewie yelled in mock terror as suddenly both he and Brian were sucked into a new dimension.

Both he and the dog landed on the green grass outside their house with a thud. "Ahhh! What just happend!" Brian asked panicked, totally confused at what was going on.

"You dropped my box of pretty magazines onto my multiverse jumping controller you nitwit! When the box landed on it, it must have pressed a button zapping us to god knows where in the multiverse"

"It's not my fault your room is a mess!" Brian replied defensively, "I've still got a damn lego block imprint on my foot"
"Oh yeah that looks sore, sorry"
"Ugh, no matter, lets just go back to our universe before something strange happens in this one. You know how to do that right?"
"You don't understand, I can't do that Brian, when you dropped that box it destroyed the mutliverse controller."
"What?! So you mean we're stuck here?!"
"Until I can find the materials to make a new one" and you put on ten or fifteen pounds Stewie thought to himself pleased, while covertly stuffing the real multiverse controller into his back pocket.

Brian sighed as he dusted himself off, "Fine, then lets just find out what twisted surprise makes this universe different from our own. I hope it isn't the psychopath universe, or worse, the universe where George Bush is still president!"
"Yeahhh, that jokes a little dated buddy."

As the pair walked inside the house everything initially looked exactly the same, until they spotted Chris, casually drawing on the couch, only he was different, he was incredibly skinny!

"Chris, is that you?" asked Brian, who was about to complement him on his appearance, but was interrupted when Chris got his first sight of Brian, "Haa!" Chris yelled while pointing, "What happened? You're even uglier than me!" he said laughing.
"Wait, what?" Brian asked perplexed, but before he could get an answer Chris bolted out the room talking about grabbing his camera.

"Well, that was weird" Stewie said nonchalantly
"Yeah..."
"Maybe the tv will give us a better picture of exactly what this universe is like?"

They hopped on the couch, Stewie grabbed the remote and started flipping through the channels casually. Tom Tucker was reporting the news, everything seemed the same, except he was considerably fatter than regular Tucker.
"Odd, you'd think a guy like that would keep in shape." Brian commented to himself.
Then they flipped to Jolly Farm Revue, where the actress playing Mother Maggie was positively obese.
"Gah, did they turn it into a fat farm this universe?" Brian exclaimed with one hand covering his eyes.
Then they flicked to an infomercial filled with sweaty fat people, they were all using this device, but instead of it exercising them, it appear to be feeding them.
"What... the... hell?!" Brian said shocked, dread and realization finally setting in. In this universe fat people were the ones considered attractive.

Before and after photos were scrolling past the screen, but instead of the fat guy becoming the skinny dude it was the other way around. 'do you sit on your butt all day but never seem to gain any weight? do you eat at the time but can never seem to put on a pound?' the announcer asked the viewer, 'if so then we have the miracle cure for you, no more binging at KFC, no more sleeping in all day, just 20 minutes on our patented eXtremeLard 5000 a day and you'll be bulking up in no time!' A small disclaimer ran past the bottom of the screen saying no results were guaranteed.
"Turn it off!" Brian protested, feeling slightly sick.

"Huh, so I guess this universe ain't so bad, right Brian? It seems like, uh, seems like people are pretty happy here, only difference from our world is everyone wants to be fatsos."
"It's terrible!"
"Aww, what's wrong? Your buff body suddenly being not being such hot potatoes anymore? Well it still is back in our universe"
"That's right! How long will it take us to make a new multiverse controller, we've got to get home right away."
"Whoa, us? I didn't know I wasn't the only super genius around here. Anyway, I will get it fixed when it's fixed."
"Ugh, well how long do you think that'll be?"
"I dunno, maybe a few days, maybe a few weeks, it's a very complex gizmo we're talkin bout here."
Brian threw the tv remote on the floor in frustration.
"Until then Brian, I suggest we'll just have to pretend we're part of this society. So, if you don't want to look like a weirdo, no more working out!"
"But?.. but!"
"No."
"Arrgh, fine... No exercise... in public anyway... But you better put all your free time into fixing that thing, I don't' want to spend a second longer in this universe than I have to."


"Oh my Brian! Are you sick?" a concerned voice intruded from the kitchen door.
When Brian turned around to check who it was, he couldn't believe his eyes, "L-lois, you're so fat! You look like a blimp!"

It was true, Lois was huge, the inadvertent compliment caused Lois to blush as she waddled over to the poor dog, still trying to grasp what he was seeing, "Oh, uh, well thank you Brian, I've been eating more, but what happened to you? You're practically skin and bones" which was far from the truth, but relatively compared to how this universe's Brian looked in the morning.

"I, uh..." employing some quick thinking, "uh, the truth is... truth is I've being living a lie. I've been wearing a fat suit for months. I've just naturally been sliming down, heh."
"Oh god Brian that's horrible, why didn't you say anything before, I'll call the vet and..."
"No! I mean uh, that's not necessary, I've already seen them in private and they say it's no problem, just a... side effect from shots they gave me a while ago, I'll be back to normal in no time." and out of this crazy town Brian thought.
"Hmm, well I can understand why you've kept this secret from us, it must be hugely embarrassing for you"
"Oh it really isn't" Brian muttered
"Well, you can count on me to help you getting back to normal, I'll start feeding you double staring today!"
"Whoa uh.. no that's really not necessary"
"Nonsense, I'm going to do everything in my power to help you fatten back up, come on, I'm making a cake right now, you can lick the bowl" Lois replied, she promptly grabbed Brian by the paw and pulled him towards the kitchen with surprising strength.

Brian looked back at the couch for help from Stewie, but all he did was smile and wave.

11131222.content:
Later, at dinner.

Brian sat at the dinner table. Dumfounded. Usually, Peter and Chris would be scarfing down their huge dinner with reckless abandon. Yet, there they were. Picking at their small portioned meal like chickens slowly eating seed. Alternatively, Lois and Meg were busy scarfing down anything edible in front of them.

Meg shoveled the triple cheesy mashed potatoes into her fat face. Her plumps lips parted to make a loud belch. She patted her engorged gut in satisfaction. "So today in school-"

"Shuddup, Meg." Peter barked munching on a carrot. Brian was bewildered by the sight, even though this was a different universe.

The dog looked over to his right to watch Lois practically inhale a mountain of food into her stomach. Splatters of food stuffs hit Brian, however, he didn't seem to mind. He didn't even care about Lois' possible health concerns or Meg's for that matter. He still wanted to hit that.

"Oh, Brian. You didn't want anything to eat?" Chris asked sipping a glass of water instead of fizzy soda. "We've got this delicious salad to enjoy or would you rather have a piece of toast? Either is fine by me if you eat it."

"Chris," Brian blinked, "Why in the hell are you talking like that?"
,
"Don't mind him. He thinks he's better than everyone because he snacks on Romanian salad instead of iceberg lettuce like most people."

"That is simply because I choose to make the most sensible selection."

"UUUurp, whateva." Lois swallowed a entire basket of buttered bread rolls with ease, "Yeah-uhh-Brian," she unbuttoned her shirt to prevent the buttons from popping off. Her gut had swelled enough from the meal to droop into her lap. "You should really eat something. You wanna grow big and strong right?"

Peter put down his copy of Time magazine and tisked, "Don't listen to her, Brian." Peter wiped the carrot crumb from his sweater vest, "She's just saying that so she won't be alone in being...fat. It's a law for women, in case you forgot. No female over that age of 16 shall be under 220 pounds. No to say you don't look dashing dear."

Peter groped Lois big, fat breast to the appeased giggle of his wife, "Yeah. I can't tell you how much I had to eat before-"

"SHUT UP, MEG!"

Meg angrily groaned, slurped the rest of her food down, and waddled off. Brian caught a glimpse of her physique. Her sphere like belly brushed against her chunky thighs and created the meaty loves handles that rested upon her incredibly wide hips. Meg barely made it through the doorway before struggling with climbing up the stairs.

"Don't worry about her, her blood sugar is still low." Lois wiped the smudges of fodd from her fat face, "Brian if you don't want food from here I know several places that serve the best food in all of Quahog. I'll take you after dinner."

"Uh, Lois I think that would be..."

111312221.content:
"Hm," Lois rubbed her chins, "Well there is the L'Espèce D'Andouille. It's a very special restaurant. Amazing drinks and huge portions. The food there is okay though."

"Doesn't stop you from eatin' it." Peter said with venom in his tone.

"What was that?"

"Nothin' sweetie."

Brian walked through the neighbourhood. No matter what universe he and Stewie landed in the layout of Quahog remained consistent. In that case, L'Espèce D'Andouille was only a few blocks away. During this time, Brian observed the new surroundings. He noted how much bigger doorways, houses, and cars were. He even saw Joe and Bonnie out in their usual life.

"See ya, Bonnie. I'm off to do fat paraplegic guy things." said the overweight Joe who sat in a reinforced titanium wheelchair. His wife Bonnie presented herself, barely able to make it past the eight foot doorway, "Don't forget your lunch." She held out a massive McBurgertown bag and set it on the side of Joe's wheelchair, which proceeded to tip over.

After traveling the usual distance, Brian had walked up to the L'Espèce D'Andouille that to his surprise looked four times its normal size, "Huh. Seems like this Universe truly puts an emphasis on their eating." Brian somehow couldn't tell from fast food restaurants being bigger than the mayor's office or plus size clothing being the norm while normal sized clothing are rare. The white furred dog walked into the fancy restaurant to thankfully an empty line. He stood before the extremely overweight seater.

"Ironic. Table for one please."

"Right this way-wheeeeze-sir." The waiter guided Brian through the restaurant. All throughout it has seemed that Wisconsin had become the standard for America's population. Left and right people stuffed themselves full of as much food as they could buy. Noticeably, some patrons were thinner or not fat at all. "Seems like this whole eating thing is a catching fad. Plenty of young people too."

The waiter stopped and set the rather large menu on the booth. "Here you are. Someone will come by with our complimentary fried loaf of buttered bread and sugar water."

Brian's eyes shot wide the moment he looked at the menu. From the words following items like steak, burger, salad like deep fried, slathered in lard, and butter injected, he could tell that people in this universe take their eating very very seriously. He looked around and saw plates as big as the tables they rested on.

"Wait a minute. Is that-? Jillian?" Her blonde head looked up from her plate. From the brief glance he got, it seems like she just joined the fad. In looking kinda pudgy in her purple dress. He returns his eyes to the menu. He didn't want to be rude. Soon...
